Sentencas: This paper presents a review of system design and analysis, control strategy, optimization and heat and mass integration of integrated solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) and reciprocating internal combustion engine (ICE) system.
Titulo: Progress and prospect of the novel integrated SOFC-ICE hybrid power system: System design, mass and heat integration, system optimization and techno-economic analysis

Sentencas: Facing the future power-fuel-power path, both SOFC and ICE can adapt to a variety of fuels, which is one evi-dence that ICE is amenable to integration with SOFC, while SOFC is more efficient, cleaner, and quieter than ICE.
Titulo: Progress and prospect of the novel integrated SOFC-ICE hybrid power system: System design, mass and heat integration, system optimization and techno-economic analysis

Sentencas: Different system topologies are classified, whose dynamic performances are also analyzed.
Titulo: Progress and prospect of the novel integrated SOFC-ICE hybrid power system: System design, mass and heat integration, system optimization and techno-economic analysis

Sentencas: In addition, the heat and mass integration of system is discussed.
Titulo: Progress and prospect of the novel integrated SOFC-ICE hybrid power system: System design, mass and heat integration, system optimization and techno-economic analysis

Sentencas: Moreover, the combustion modes of ICE, which can be applied to steady combustion, high efficiency and low emissions, are analyzed and compared.
Titulo: Progress and prospect of the novel integrated SOFC-ICE hybrid power system: System design, mass and heat integration, system optimization and techno-economic analysis

Sentencas: Meanwhile, the potential and methods of system waste heat recovery are discussed.
Titulo: Progress and prospect of the novel integrated SOFC-ICE hybrid power system: System design, mass and heat integration, system optimization and techno-economic analysis

Sentencas: The exergy analysis, energy density and techno-economy are discussed.
Titulo: Progress and prospect of the novel integrated SOFC-ICE hybrid power system: System design, mass and heat integration, system optimization and techno-economic analysis

Sentencas: Finally, the results are discussed in the last section with the final conclusion that SOFC-ICE systems are very suitable for long-distance transportation such as maritime and aviation, which can also solve problems of the carbon and pollutant emissions with the background of engine cannot be replaced in maritime, while the system can adapt a variety of alternative fuels.
Titulo: Progress and prospect of the novel integrated SOFC-ICE hybrid power system: System design, mass and heat integration, system optimization and techno-economic analysis
